answerText: eigenvalue[10] By the Cayley-Hamilton theorem, eigenvalues are roots of this polynomial, which is defined as the determinant of the quantity lambda times the identity matrix minus A.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 6 | 7 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Putting a square matrix in upper-triangular form puts these values in the diagonal. For 10 points each: [10] Identify these numbers symbolized lambda, which for a square matrix A and some vector x, satisfy the relation A times x equals lambda times x.
